TunableVariant.name: tests_or_greeting
TunableVariant.description: Either play a greeting if the tests pass, or reference another TunableTestedGreetingGroup that will perform it's behavior if the tests pass.

TunableTuple.name: mixer
TunableTuple.description: Mixer reactions that Sims can play before socializing. This particular reaction works well with Social Mixers because we can guarantee that the Sim will greet the target within social constraints. Just remember to override the super affordance to a social super interaction.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on the subject.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this super affordance will be the SI for the reaction mixer. If disabled, we use the posture's SI. Note: This should only be tuned if we are trying to push a SocialMixerInteraction as a reaction mixer. In that case you want to push its SocialSuperInteraction. Furthermore, if the pusher of this reaction is a Social interaction whose SI matches the override type, we'll reuse that SI as the mixer's SI.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The super affordance to use for this reaction mixer.

TunableTuple.name: tests
TunableTuple.description: Child TunableTestedGreetingGroup nodes that run if the tests pass.

TunableList.name: child_nodes
TunableList.description: A list of children to run through as children of this branch. If any one passes, it will not process any more children.

Tunable.description: A child node that represents a set of tests to run as well as child nodes or a greeting.
